param.arg: arguments for task action (eg: string for search task, numerical id for specific term data)
param.output: Output format, can be JSON or XML. Optional parameter, XML by default

fetch.action: Search and retrieve terms using exact matching

suggest.action: Simple search and retrieve terms who start with string (only string)

suggestDetails.action: Search and retrieve terms who start with string (term_id, term, and more data)

fetchCode.action: Retrieve simple term data by code

letter.action: Search and retrieve terms was beginning with letter $arg

fetchAlt.action: Retrieve alternative/non prefered terms for one ID

fetchDown.action: Retrieve more specific terms for one ID

fetchUp.action: Retrieve hierarquical structure for one ID

fetchRelated.action: Retrieve related terms for one ID

fetchDirectTerms.action: Retrieve alternative, related and direct hieraquical terms for one term_id

fetchURI.action: Search and retrieve data about URI or internet entities linked to one term_id

fetchTargetTerms.action: Search and retrieve data about target terms mapped via web services for one term_id

fetchSourceTerms.action: Search and retrieve terms mapped in target vocabulary for a given term

fetchTerms.action: Retrieve simple term data for some coma separated IDs (example: 3,6,98)
fetchTerms.arg: some coma separated IDs (for example: arg=3,6,98)

fetchRelatedTerms.action: Retrieve simple related term data for some coma separated terms IDs (example: 3,6,98)
fetchRelatedTerms.arg: some coma separated IDs (for example: arg=3,6,98)

fetchSimilar.action: Search and retrieve similar term for string search expresion ($arg)

randomTerm.action: Retrieves last random term data. Optionally you can filter terms with specific type of notes (use tag note, ex: NA for scope note)

termsSince.action: Retrieve data about terms who was created or modified since given date
termsSince.arg: date from do you want to obtain data

relationsSince.action: Retrieve data about terminological relations who was created or modified since given date
relationsSince.arg: date from do you want to obtain data
